results.title: Prepregnancy metformin use associated with lower risk of severe nausea and vomiting of pregnancy and hyperemesis gravidarum.
results.text_hl: Prepregnancy @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use associated with lower risk of severe @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea and vomiting@@@ of pregnancy and @DISEASE_Hyperemesis_Gravidarum @DISEASE_MESH:D006939 @@@hyperemesis gravidarum@@@.

results.title: Efficacy and safety of polyethylene glycol loxenatide in type 2 diabetic patients: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials
results.text_hl: People who received @CHEMICAL_polyethylene_glycol_loxenatide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C000601947 @@@PEX168@@@ alone or with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ showed more common @DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal adverse effects@@@, especially @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea and vomiting@@@ (p < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Salamah HM, Marey A, Elsayed E, Hasan MT, Mahmoud A, Abualkhair KA, Abo-Elnour DE, Abdelhaleem IA, Abd-Elgawad M. Efficacy and safety of polyethylene glycol loxenatide in type 2 diabetic patients: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials Sci Rep. 2023 Nov 3;13(1):19041. PMID: 37923756

results.title: The role of metformin in treatment of weight gain associated with atypical antipsychotic treatment in children and adolescents: A systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials
results.text_hl: There were higher odds of @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea-vomiting@@@ [OR: 4.07, CI: 1.32-12.54, p-value: 0.02] and @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ [OR: 2.93, CI: 1.50-5.71, p-value: 0.002] in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group.

results.title: Metformin for the Prevention of Hyperemesis Gravidarum: An Observational Cohort Study.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To evaluate if @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment prior to pregnancy reduces the likelihood of @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea and vomiting@@@ in pregnancy (NVP) and @DISEASE_Hyperemesis_Gravidarum @DISEASE_MESH:D006939 @@@hyperemesis gravidarum@@@ (@DISEASE_Hyperemesis_Gravidarum @DISEASE_MESH:D006939 @@@HG@@@) compared to no exposure.

citations.NLM: Sillis L, Heinonen EW, Ceulemans M, Johnson D, Luo Y, Chambers CD. Metformin for the Prevention of Hyperemesis Gravidarum: An Observational Cohort Study. BJOG. 2025 May 29;():. PMID: 40443168

results.title: Metformin in the digestive tract.
results.text_hl: ...After ingestion of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, a drug of the @CHEMICAL_Biguanides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001645 @@@biguanide@@@ class, there are @DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal effects@@@ in the form of @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea and vomiting@@@, and about 30% of the drug is recovered in feces.

citations.NLM: Vidon N, Chaussade S, Noel M, Franchisseur C, Huchet B, Bernier JJ. Metformin in the digestive tract. Diabetes Res Clin Pract. 1988 Feb 19;4(3):223-9. PMID: 3359923

results.title: Ondansetron and metformin-induced gastrointestinal side effects.
results.text_hl: Of the 98 subjects treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, 22 developed side effects to match the study entry criteria.

results.title: Metformin in polycystic ovary syndrome: systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: We found no evidence of any effect on body mass index or waist:hip ratio. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was associated with a higher incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea, vomiting@@@, and other @DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal disturbance@@@.

citations.NLM: Lord JM, Flight IH, Norman RJ. Metformin in polycystic ovary syndrome: systematic review and meta-analysis. BMJ. 2003 Oct 25;327(7421):951-3. PMID: 14576245
